extends java.lang.Object
    Created by adam on 12/16/16. A further refactor of original, for more streamlined design, and better long term usability.

      • getComputedAngle

        public float getComputedAngle()
        Returns:
        computedAngle - the current range constrained angle being used

      • clearHistoricData

        public void clearHistoricData()
        Clears historical integral and derivative data. Must be called at the beginning of every movement function to get accurate correction data.

      • updateHeadings

        public void updateHeadings()
        Shifts the latest heading into the previous, and sets the latest heading to a new angular orientation data point.

      • setTuning

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a negated, constrained version of the angle.

      • addTarget

        public void addTarget(float angle)
        adds to the current target. Must be called in turning functions to update the PID target by the number of degrees the robot has to turn.
        Parameters:
        angle - the vale to add to the current target

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(float target)
        Method to manually set target value. Not used, but potentially necessary for some implementations
        Parameters:
        target - the new target value.

      • initializeTarget

        public void initializeTarget()
        Default initialization method, sets the current target to the computed angle.

        Sets the current computed target value
        Parameters:

      • calculateVars

        public void calculateVars(float timeDiff)
        Calculates the proportional, integral, and derivative terms
        Parameters:
        timeDiff - Time since the last iteration of the loop, i.e., currentTime - previousTime

      • calculateAngles

        public float calculateAngles()
        Calculates computed angle value, updating the number of full rotations accordingly, and accounting for this in calculations.
        Returns:
        the newest angular orientation data point

      • getCorrectedValue

        public float getCorrectedValue(float timeDiff)
        Wrapper method which updates internal data, and does the actual PID calculation. PID formula: u(t) = Kp * e(t) + Ki * (integral(0, t) e(x) dx) + Kd * (de(t) / dt) where: Kp = p constant Ki = i constant Kd = d constant u(t) = current adjustment value e(t) = desired value - current value integral(0, t) e(x) dx = integral of function f(x) with respect to x on interval [0, t] d(e)/dt = the derivative of function e(t) with respect to t.
        Parameters:
        timeDiff - the time between the last loop iteration, and the current iteration. Passed as an argument to calculateVars.
        Returns:
        The corrected value based on the PID formula
